result.execSummary:
The defendant Natalie N. Norton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.
No contact with Girls in Pearls or Margaret O'Connor-Govett except letter of apology within 60 days and submit to agent to forward if appropriate.

Participate in any other assessment or counseling deemed appropriate by the agent and could include continuing with current counselor. 
Provide DNA sample.

Pay restitution as determined after the restitution hearing. 
Court orders restitution hearing be held within 60 days.

Referral to Court Commissioner for Restitution Hearing /s/ TBE 02/17/16

Defendant Natalie N. Norton in court with attorney Sandra J. Zenor. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:46 a.m.  Court calls the case. 
  
State files Amended Information. 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defense received a copy of the amended information and waives its reading.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1 & 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State files Victim Impact Statement. 
Atty Zenor makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Counts 1 & 2 - 
120 days jail STAYED concurrent with each other
2 days credit.
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve half the sentence on home monitor if she qualifies. 
Allowed to transfer the jail sentence to Wood County if desired and counties agree. 

Probation for 2 years: 
No contact with Girls in Pearls or Margaret O'connor-Govett except letter of apology within 60 days and submit to agent to forward if appropriate.
Participate in any other assessment or counseling deemed appropriate by the agent and could including continuing with current counselor. 
Pay restitution as determined after the restitution hearing. 
Court orders restitution hearing be held within 60 days. 
In each count pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Provide DNA sample.

State files Information.

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Defendant Natalie N. Norton in court with attorney Sandra Zenor. ADA Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived.
